availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John L. Warden (Wayne County, Kentucky, saddler and soldier)

body.p: Wayne County, Kentucky saddler and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of James V. Warden and Elizabeth Warden. Saddler in Wayne County, Kentucky in 1860. Served in the 12th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as Quartermaster Sergeant, 2nd Lieutenant, and Captain from January 31, 1862 to .

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Wayne County, Monticello, p. 232.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 850.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 261.
